articles.title: AI a daily experiment for Sendle boss
articles.description: James Chin Moody, the co-founder of Sendle, has recommended young executives get into a daily habit of training with AI, embracing the technology which stands to upturn the future of the workplace.
articles.content:
The launch of Open AI ChatGPT3 at the end of last year sparked an AI rush across global industries, working to figure out how the tools will be used alongside workers.

articles.title: Palantir lobbied UK disabilities minister to use software to tackle benefits fraud
articles.description: US data firm wanted to brief Tom Pursglove on how its technology could help recover ‘large amounts’
articles.content:
The US tech firm Palantir lobbied the UK disabilities minister to adopt new technology to crack down on benefits fraud, emails released to the Guardian have revealed.

articles.title: China drafts rules for using facial recognition technology
articles.description: China's cyberspace regulator said on Tuesday it has issued draft rules to oversee the security management of facial recognition technology in the country, following concerns raised in public about overuse of the technology.

articles.title: Top Russian missile maker's data breached by hackers of North Korea, says report
articles.description: North Korean hackers breached a major Russian missile developer for five months in 2022, stealing technology
articles.content:
In a bid to steal technology, an elite group of North Korean hackers secretly breached computer networks at a major Russian missile developer for nearly five months in 2022, reported Reuters on Tuesday.
